Reviews.Title: “back to the seventies”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchmannl
Reviews.Content: It was like I was in a new episode of "Back to the future": Since the seventies they did not change anything anymore. First time that I had a feeling I was sleeping in a museum... So, hotel is very dated, my aircon was not working probably, however a colleague told me his aircon was working well, I assume I was not lucky? My room was clean, staff is average. Would I stay here again? No, most likely for the same money you can find better places in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “A 3 Star Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: giodxb
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a standard room. Room decor very 1980's European, old style beds and linen, dark wooden furniture, heavy drapes, dark marble in the bathroom, slightly worn carpeting and wallpaper. However it was clean, has excellent shower pressure, opening windows and i had an excellent sleep courtesy of the great pillows and very low noise levels. Lobby decorated in the same slightly heavy and dark style, lobby bar has no atmosphere at all. Elevators are located up 2 steps so i am not sure how a wheelchair guest may reach their room. Excellent breakfast, up to the standards of UK or US style buffet. Staff are competent and have good English, they just don't like smiling or initiating assistance. Hotel is located within a 10 minute walk of 3 Metro Stations, access to the city is very easy, also a bus to the City Centre ( SOL) is only 3 minutes away.There is always a taxi waiting outside, Barrajas Airport is about 25 minutes away. The area around the hotel is quiet and upmarket, feels very safe, nice choice of restaurants. I can recommend this hotel if you don't need to be right in the middle of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Norma W
Reviews.Content: Melia Galgos was okay, just a bit dated back to the 70's and room smelled of cigar, other than that it was fine. It was pretty close to our bus route and attractions. I will probaby stay at a different hotel next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; however several issues.”
Reviews.Author: tsolano
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several days at hotel while visiting Madrid. Room was clean and is well appointed bathrooms also to satisfaction. Internet service was terrible. To have access in room there is a charge of 12 euro a day; the signal quality is poor and the connection very erratic. Also the paid internet is only available for one machine, if you try to connect another machine it is not possible, big limitation to those who travel with several devices. Totally unable to use Skype, other connections worked irregularly. In the lobby there is also free internet; however, same quality issues. It appears they have a poor ISP and do nothing about it. The layout of the lobby is also inconvenient since the elevators are set higher than the lobby and you must go upstairs to reach them; not a good plan if you have luggage with rollers. Also at reception when we arrived we struggled with the luggage from our car on the street until we reached the front desk, at that time the smiling doorman approached us to ask if he could help with the luggage. The hotel also has a nice morning breakfast buffet which is very well appointed especially when you want more than the traditional Spanish breakfast, coffee and a roll.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jay-BKKJay
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a good breakfast and centrally located to most tourist attractions. The room was adequate although it had a distinct smell (mold). The bed was comfortable and the shower was fine. I was disappointed with the gym but otherwise a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed me stay at Melia Galgos”
Reviews.Author: frapedia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay at a comfortable and clean room. Nice breakfast buffet and easily accessible by means of metro and bus services. Unfortunately there was a distinct smell in the corridor of the hotel but it was not the same inside the room. They charge 4 euros per hour for wi-fi in the guest rooms (which is not acceptable for a hotel of this class)

Reviews.Title: “Melia Hotel in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Fonst
Reviews.Content: Generally I am not a Melia Hotels lover, but Galgos has been really good. Although my #701 room has been just good for a single traveler, all the rest has been very good. Breakfast, Business Center (IT access 5EUR/hour!! - FREE WIFI in the lobby and bar areas), Service, all good. Melia may take care about huge groups stationing in the lobby waiting for their departures (bit noisy!). Shopping area in the neighbors (Serrano).

Reviews.Title: “New Chocolate Muffins at the Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: This week when we stayed at the Melia Galgos, we discovered that there were new chocolate muffins at the breakfast buffet. They were small, and when you bit into them you discovered that inside there was a fruit mermelade inside, perhaps apricot. Simply delicious. Now that I am back home I have to start reducing!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel north of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Hans B
Reviews.Content: Good locaation if you visit north part of Madrid, very good service (lot of service staff). Excellent breakfast. Very hard beds. The gym is simple but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Old feel but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DiverT22
Reviews.Content: A hotel with old feel but, still relatively comfortable. I stayed only one night so, totally familiar with the facilities but, as a base to work from the hotel was well situated to my office and main amenities. The food was basic but, plenty of restaurants locally outside. Wifi was provided in the rooms but, you had to pay to use, which I would of expected free given the price. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Condsider other alternatives”
Reviews.Author: carolinaBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January before and post a Spanish tour. It was booked by our tour operator. What a shocker! The location was convenient if you were prepared to travel by bus to the major sights. The hotel was like a sauna - maybe the airconditioning wasn't working or maybe it was completely absent. The staff were very unfriendly. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: idl34
Reviews.Content: The hotel is based in the commercial district of Madrid. The centre however is near by both bus and metro. The hotel is large, but does not feel crowded. The rooms are a decent size and are comfortable. There is a mini bar in the room, though this is very expensive. The hotel has a bar, restraunt and health and fitness centre. It also has conference facilities. My room was overlooking a busy side street, but the noise is not too bad and disn't disturb my sleep. The staff are very friendly and helpful and go out of their way to help. I can recommend this hotel for a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel just a bit under 4 stars. There were good things and bad things… My room was clean but a bit worn-out and there was a smell that stayed even after opening the window for the whole day. I got a bed that was actually 2 single beds connected, I hate it. The mattress was quite hard and the linens were pleasant – I don’t like it when the mattress is too soft and sometimes you feel the springs… this was not the case here. The room itself is quite big for European hotels. There was a nice LCD screen with 60 channels but only one channel in English: BBC news You can hear people in the room next to you. I could hear them slamming the door, in the shower and on the phone…At night time this can drive me nuts! Since it is winter, the hotel air condition only works as heating so it is too warm and very dry…. I had to open the windows to get some fresh air inside. The location is kind of center but you need to walk a few minutes in order to get to the main streets. Not a bad choice to stay but not my cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Blake_Aus
Reviews.Content: The experience of this hotel was terrible. I could probably forgive the fact that the rooms are dingy and not to a 4 star standard and the internet connection is ridiculously slow, if the staff were helpful. This was not the case. The staff at this hotel are among the worst hotel staff I have ever come across. They are rude, unhelpful and just plain horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at the Melia Galgos for the following reasons: 1. Good location by Calle Serrano in the Barrio Salamanca, the safest barrio in the center of town. 2. Wonderful breakfast buffet. 3. Friendly employees, also very professional. I discovered another reason in my recent stay. There is a hotel restaurant called Diabolo in the basement. Never went there before because we are usually too busy and away from the hotel all day. However we tried it one day and were hooked, going there two more times. The restaurant is spacious and elegant with pink marbleized walls. The food is very good and reasonably priced. There is a weekly menu that costs 26.50 euros, with a good variety of foods. Try the carrillera, a wonderful and very tender beef, with a great sauce that you will want to dry up with your bread!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Lee01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few blocks from metro lines number 9 and 5. The hotel room very hot. They turn the AC off after the summer so there was no way to cool down the room, opening the window did not provide much relief. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms could have been cleanier, dirty carpet.

Reviews.Title: “below par”
Reviews.Author: maura p
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and from the start I knew that this hotel was going to be a problem. Surly front desk staff. Terrible wi-fi service not included in the expensive room rate. When I complained about the slow, expensive wi-fi, the staff questioned me about the amount I was downloading. The first room I was given was like a coffin -- no windows, no a/c. Was able to move to another room on the busy street so at least I had some ventilation thanks to a window -- but as another reviewer has mentioned - there doesn't appear to be a functioning HVAC system. With plenty of other hotels to choose from, I don't plan to come back. Old rusty iron provided grudgingly, no real hangers, no basic tv stations such as CNN International.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maferter
Reviews.Content: We live this hotel, location is the best, service is great. Great choce!

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: CDNVoyager604
Reviews.Content: Here for business for one week and was disappointed from the start. The front counter staff are understaffed, and hence, extremely slow even when processing a line of five or so guests. In fact, any time I had to speak to the front desk, unless it was late at night, always incurred a long delay. One guy at the front desk was quite rude - the women are nice - but one of the guys (older guy) was a jerk. In my room, the carpet covers up indentations in many places in the floor. You'd think that they would fix that. They gave me a room that overlooked the inner ventilation space - so I had to hear and watch the central air conditioning.Then there's the ventilation that carries cigarette smoke! Puke. Room was a bit dingy and smelly. Speaking of smelly, the downstairs restaurant had an awful odor - good thing they were closing when I went to eat. Breakfast was OK - although the food was off - eggs were not well done - but there were enough other things to make up for it. Location wise, this hotel is not that convenient except that it's close to the subway. I would not stay at this hotel again as there are far better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “No aircon!”
Reviews.Author: eng98
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a night, to be exact, 31-Oct-11. When we arrived at the hotel about 3pm, there was a notice saying that there is intermittent power outage in the hotel till 7pm that night. We went into our room and boy, it was really hot and stuffy in there. And the room is facing the afternoon sun (main street), so it's like a greenhouse in there. So I called the operator and checked if the air conditioning is on and was told that its out due to the outage. No problem at all. So my wife and I took refuge outside the street, which was much cooler, thinking that we will return after dark when the room cools down and power is restored. When we came back after dark, about 6pm. The room was still very warm. So we called the operator again. This time I was told that it is the cold season now and there will be no aircon! This is really bad as the room was so warm even when we opened the window! The worst is that the curtains in the room has to be wide opened in order to fully open the window. It was a terrible night for us as it was so warm. Though It's fall now, so the temperature is slightly cooler, in the 20s (degree C). To me it only cool, so i would expect the air conditioning to be on. As for the rest of the room, so complaint. Location of the hotel is good if you are going to the shopping street. We didn't go far expect the shopping street. There is also a cafe/restaurant (Oka) behind the corner of the hotel serving good tapas and breakfast. Value for money. It's not listed in tripadvisor yet so I can't do add my review. We went there for our afternoon tapas and breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you like disco music”
Reviews.Author: drivesouth66
Reviews.Content: 2:00 am on a Friday morning as I write this while the pounding base of disco music, coming from where??, fills the small room. Other than the free music this is a typical older European hotel. I've stayed here several times on business and room sizes vary. Good breakfast buffet. Safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: NMC10_11
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, located in a nice neighborhood, a little bit far from downtown (puerta del sol, gran via). This is a great place for someone who is on business trip or has already known Madrid, since the best way to get to the most tourist places is by metro. The only inconvenience of this hotel is that there is no free wi - fi in the rooms, and in order to use the free service you must go to the hotel's bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Snehal_Kulshreshtha
Reviews.Content: Good location and decent breakfast spread-great service in the bar-super coffee...but food in the speciality dining leaves a lot to be desired as does the service there... Surprisingly there isnt a fitness center there...or did I miss it? Rooms are weary and tired looking but are reasonably clean and well maintained. Also the room size is surprisingly small but I guess that is the case with most European hotels..A word about the staff-they are extremely friendly at the front desk, lobby bar lounge and the breakfast area. Needless to say the location makes up for just about anything negative if there was...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gaynorchin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a quiet street just off the main rd which is 3 minutes walk from the bus stops. Walking distance to the high fashion brands such as Gucci, Loewe, Prada and Tods. The American embassy is directly across the road and the city centre is about 15 minutes away. The room I had was a double bed, with a fridge and mini bar. The bathroom was spacious, very clean with bathroom amenities. Staff were very helpful in giving directions, places of interests and in recommending restaurants. The breakfast buffet I heard had an extensive range of cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, cereal, eggs etc.

Reviews.Title: “The beginning to a great trip”
Reviews.Author: drlooper
Reviews.Content: This was our initial hotel for a tour of Spain and Portugal. The hotel was clean and efficient but unfortunately we arrived while the dining room was undergoing renovation. We were able to get some appetizers from the bar. It is located in a reasonably located area of Madrid and we certainly felt safe on the streets nearby. At the time it was our first experience with Spain and we didn't have anything to compare it to. Now, we would rate it middle of the road. Some were better, some were worse. I can't speak to the affordability since our stay was included in the price of the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Gaffeur
Reviews.Content: This is a plane vanilla business/coach party hotel. It really caters for those who want to be off for meetings all day, or sightseeing all day. You wouldn't want to linger. That said, it is efficient, clean, and the rooms are generally fine. Clearly one or two are bad, but mine had two very comfortable single beds, a good flat screen TV and a decent, very clean, bathroom. It is very 1980's, but it is clean and tidy. The feedback about staff is interesting. What you are getting is typical Madrid service - they seem to do everything with a slight air of disinterest. And it is all over Madrid (there are exceptions but not many). I wandered around many shops not being even vaguely bothered by staff. The Melia Galgos is actually better than average. I found the reception friendly and efficient, the restaurant staff the same, and the housekeeping staff all greeted me with a good morning or good evening. Perfectly fine. By the way, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, calm hotel near American Embassy in quiet Madrid neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Fattycrab
Reviews.Content: Melia Galgos- The Melia Galgos is not smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Madrid- but that is its charm. Clean and spacious as far as Madrid lodgings go, the rooms with comfy beds are quiet like the neighborhood and perfect for a stay of a few days. It is in the Salamanca area and therefore a mix of residences and embassies. The American Embassy is close by as is the spectacular Museum Lazaro Galdiano. The nearest metro is Nunez de Balboa. The hotel bar has wifi if you have a drink. Did not try to have the wifi ( wee-fee) in the rooms. After being in Spain during a particularly warm spell, the AC was a real luxury and kept the room cool. For breakfast, the buffet may be pricey and without any promotions, it may be better to go across the street a bar where one can have café con leche and an order of churros. I have read other postings where some claim that this not really a four star but I disagree for Madrid. There was a group while I was there and I barely ever saw them.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and trying to keep up appearances”
Reviews.Author: alanisinecuador
Reviews.Content: Overpriced small rooms. The breakfast buffett is not bad, but the staff is indifferent and obviously unhappy. The location is nice in a high-end, family-oriented neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oreverendo
Reviews.Content: Old rooms, run-down carpets. First room had great beds, but had strange noises probably from the heating system. Asked to change rooms, but got an even smaller room and that with two small children. Second room didn't have the noises, but one bed was lopsided, but I gave up since we were only going to stay two more nights. Breakfast was really nice with good variety. Uneatable food from the 'Diabolo' restaurant which I sent back, but still had to pay half. Location is great, since metro is in walking distance and the Salamanca district has quite a lot of commerce and restaurants/bars. Price for Wifi Internet is high (4 Euro/hour; 12 Euro/24 hours) and didn't work in our room. Only staff at the front desk speak English. If it hadn't been for the price we got the room I would have been very mad. Fortunately we got it for the price of a top secret hotel from lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, for a combined business and leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: netbluez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Galgos in Madrid for two nights in Feb 2011. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from the Metro Nunez de Balboa, which is well connected to the city centre. The reception staff are not as friendly and polite as the ones I routinely encounter in Northern Europe. The room is spacious, well kept and very comfortable. The breakfast is excellent, with a good spread and some bubbly wine thrown in. It is a short cab ride to the Prado and Thyssen museums (under Euro 6) and to the business centres around Avenida de America and Plaza de Espana (under Euro 8). Given the inexpensive cabs, I would recommend that you use them instead of the Metro, when staying at Melia Galgos. Overall, this is a hotel I would come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MissEricaMichelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Galgos for 5 days for a business trip. The hotel was overpriced. I would not recommend paying for the hotel's internet. I was very unhappy with the internet. I paid 40 euro for a week of wireless internet. The speed was horrible. I could not even hold a converstion on Skype. If I pay 40 euro to use the internet, I expect the quality to be good. I had a hard time sleeping at the hotel. It was very noisy late into the night outside the hotel. The overall appearance and size of the hotel room was OK, but expected more for the price. One thing I did like about the hotel was the breakfast. The breakfast bar's food quality and quantity was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights in the Melia Galgos Hotel. Our room had a new and large flat screen LED TV and new beds. As always, the breakfast buffet was great. We travel frequently all over Spain and think that this hotel has the best breakfast buffet in Spain. It is one of the few places where they serve Iberian ham. As usual, the personnel are very friendly and courteous. The location by Calle Serrano is wonderful. We were able to see the Christmas lights on the street. We do not have to worry about security in the area because it is in a very upscale neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: OldTraveller55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quieter area, close to the metro station and bus. It was quite roomy and very clean. The buffet was fantastic with a wide variety that would suit most tastes. We were with our 7 year old grandson and the restaurant staff were very friendly with him. There are a lot of nice shops if you are interested in shopping, a few cultural sights are within walking distance as well. We felt very safe walking at night in this area, as opposed to other areas like the Puerto Del Sol and Gran Via. Hop on Hop off bus stops close to the Hotel as well. A lot of restaurants in the area as well with good food, but a bit high in price. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “dated 4 stars with smelly room and corridor”
Reviews.Author: londonportsmouth
Reviews.Content: It was probably a nice hotel when in the 80's but with more modern alternatives like the NH chains in Spain, I would avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiler58
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we booked it at the last minute and got a great deal. The rooms were spacious and clean, the bathroom spotless too. On arrival the staff were very helpful, explaining where to eat nearby and how to get into the centre of madrid, which was 5 minutes by taxi & 5-7minutes by bus. The buffet breakfast was amazing, one of the best we've had, set in an ultra modern dining room - a lovely way to start the day! We loved the location of this hotel and will definately be returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel. Excellent rooms and services!”
Reviews.Author: Korinthios
Reviews.Content: Melia Galgos is one of the most cleaver choises in Madrid. Its position is great (Salamanca area), because it is very close to Calle de Castallana and Calle di Serano with great stores, bars and traditional restaurants. Hotel has an excellent latin club with live music to the basement! In addition, the breakfast is almost amazing. You can find anything, in best quality and plenary commodity. What it worths more than everything else is the rooms of the hotel, which are spacious, very very clear and quiet. Whenever i will be back in Madrid there is no chance to stay anywhere else except Melia Galgos!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like to visit Madrid in the spring and fall to look at all the museum exhibitions. We like the friendliness of the people who work in this hotel. They are very professional and will try to help all the clients. The location is great, beside Calle Serrano. We particularly love the breakfast buffet, because you can find everything you would want to have for breakfast. The buffet really tempts one and it is very difficult to control yourself here because the food is so very good. We travel very frequently all over Spain and so we have known many hotels. But of all the hotels we have tried, this hotel has the best breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Really great few days”
Reviews.Author: Chocolit
Reviews.Content: Just back from Madrid after a 3 night city break with my wife and teenage daughters. Airport arrival quick and easy, metro trip with one change of line was also fine. My guidebook suggested 10 tickets were discounted - true but not by much 10 for 9 Euros rather than 10 - plus an additional charge for trips to and from airport. Still better value than getting a cab. I had done the research to get to the hotel - one change of metro line pink 8 to Columbia, and then Purple 9 four stops to Nunez de Balboa station. However there are two exits one of which is significantly closer to the hotel than the other! you need the one on Calle Velazquez. Hotel staff very good - our rooms were on the 4th floor - not as close together as we might have liked but it worked out fine. Being Brits I had brought a travel kettle and some UHT milk which was fine in the minibar! Word of warning - the mini bar is ultra expensive and so do not drink or eat anything ;-). Room was great, bed good, bathroom fine. We had a view over the local church - the girls looked out onto the main road and the American Embassy. Had i known I would have brought my gym kit - small but effective fitness room on the 7th floor plus a Jacuzzi and you can get out onto the roof for great views or a sunbathe. I had booked B&B and the buffet breakfast is seriously excellent! Loads of choice and as much as you can eat (we certainly ate lots and enjoyed it)., On our first evening we decided to try out the restaurant which in the basement of the hotel. Room service menu was expensive as we expected, but there was an excellent dinner offer - 3 courses plus glass of wine or beer for 25 Euro per person. Remember that the locals eat late - restaurant empty till 9.45pm. Staff really friendly and service good, we had a very nice meal and I would recommend that you at least look at the menu offer if it is still on. We walked quite a lot and used the metro (usually starting from Ruben Dario green line 5) – there are also great shops within walking of the hotel! We did use El Cortes Ingles several times, 10 mins from the hotel, for snacks and the occasional bottle of wine - remember the cost of the minibar and do pack a corkscrew! All in all a very good hotel well placed but not central – area felt very safe even late at night and we all slept well. I would recommend the hotel and return again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast Buffett”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld22
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't in the heart of Madrid, but it's in the Salamanca Area, so there is great shopping nearby. And the metro is a 15 minute walk, so you can get to where you need to. The one thing about this hotel is that the breakfast buffett was impressive. The spread is great and you can really load up for the day. They had everything you could ask for in a breakfast - both hot and cold items. There is a great tapas bar right around the corner - I can't remember the name, but it's a great place where the locals go. But if you're coming to see Madrid, you might be better off getting a hotel closer to all the city sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a relatively quiet and upscale quarter”
Reviews.Author: Zrubavel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights in the Melia Galgos. The hotel is very clean and well managed with comfortable beds , nice bathroom, and a superb breakfast buffet that offers everything possible. The staff was very helpful. The location of the hotel is not central, but has easy access to the metro ( about 5 minute walk). A very good restaurant nearby is the Septimer , italian sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Davo666
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel is quite good enough. On arrival I encountered a rather unfriendly check-in service and discovered that my single room was very, very small (although I was offered the opportunity of an upgrade). My view faced out directly into other guests' windows and I soon discovered there were no hotel 'basics' such as an iron or kettle. The price of food & drink are far too inflated for what you receive (in fairness, a common complaint in Europe!) and even if you do eat in the hotel, the waiter service is fairly abrupt and business-like. Where possible, I like to even my reviews out with a number of positive comments but I'm afraid I am struggling to name but one regarding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Gandalf321
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES. Large, comfortable room. Plush looking hotel. Quiet neighborhood. Quiet room. NEGATIVES. High prices. For example, the hotel charges 4 euros for an hour of wifi internet connection. Also, as someone else noted, seems like "pretentious service". Staff answered questions, but didn't seem to really care if you were happy. Location is a bit isolated from most tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Pretentious Service”
Reviews.Author: scully607
Reviews.Content: This hotel acts a little like it's better than everything else in the area when it's really just a standard 3.5 - 4-star hotel. Rooms are clean and decently appointed, but nothing special. The location is wonderful and given Madrid's price in general, I'd say this is a pretty good value. It's close enough to everything but still quiet and was exactly what we were looking for, minus the pretentious service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for a great few days in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: StuartHolden
Reviews.Content: A last minute trip to Madrid to visit my brother-in-law saw us book this excellently located hotel. Just off the end of Serrano and within easy walking distance of Sol and Goya, the hotel's real trump card was the Cuban bar in the basement, featuring live music and dancing. A real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in quiet area of Madrid, close to great shops”
Reviews.Author: vivi0000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of my overseas holiday. It was the perfect way to relax in city I love. I stayed here at the Melia back in 2007 when I did a tour and spent 4 nights then. So I was glad to return to a clean and quiet hotel this year. I was very lucky to get a great deal for the hotel - I paid roughly 59-65 Euros a night (room only) via the internet. Breakfast is 20 euros and it is the best breakfast I've have in Madrid. It is served in the breakfast room on Ground Floor. There are plentiful platters of fresh fruit (watermelon, rockmelon, strawberries, oranges, pineapple etc), a large variety of cold cut meats, eggs, and hot food (eggs, croquettes - yummy!, mushrooms). Each morning when I was there there was a fresh leg of ham which would always be cut when the small plate of ham ran out - the best fresh ham you could ever eat! There are different variety of breads / bread rolls and you can toast bread if you like. The hotel has a couple of restaurants / bars but I didn't try them. I did order room service and it was very prompt. The hotel directory that is in each room is very comprehensive with useful numbers for calling overseas, transport information and the menus from the restaurants and room service (it is in Spanish and English). My room was always spotless. The bathroom was adequate althought the bath was on the small side. As I am a tall person, it was definitely too short for me. The hotel provides safes free of charge which are located in the wardrobes - you will need to enter a 6 digit code. I used the business centre and the cost for about 30mins was a little over 7 euros. The internet connection was fast. Also, there is free printing inside the business centre. There is a luggage room where you can store your luggage. A taxi ride from the airport took about 25 mins - expect to pay around 20-25 euros to get there. The TV has spanish, french, english and one portuguese channels. Check in was very quick as I had arrived around 10.30pm so was glad to go straight to my room. Reception staff can give you a map of Madrid if you ask. It you want to go to Gran Via, you can walk and it is best to do that now. It will take you about 20-25 mins. There are some road works / construction going on along Calle Serrano. From what I could read, there is an underground fast-speed link being built so traffic is pretty heavy during the day. If you want to do day trips around Madrid eg Royal Palace, Segovia, Avila etc, reception staff can provide you with a list of excursions and the travel company can pick you up from the hotel. I did a 1/2 day tour to El Escorial and got picked up to join the other tourists. The only thing I would say is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear people talking and doing other activities! I definitely would stay here again as it is quiet, in a great location and the hotel has a fantastic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid, Melia Galgos Hotel, A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JoyceWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: As a woman alone and because I was staying in Madrid for several weeks, it was important to me to be in a comfortable, upscale and safe hotel. The hotel is comfortable and located in one of the best neighborhoods of Madrid “the Barrio de Salamanca”. In general, the staff was polite and helpful. They upgraded me and gave me a bigger room since I was going to spend a few weeks at the hotel. Unfortunately, a week before my departure, I noticed that one of my white shirts was missing from my closet and I notified the desk and the laundry staff. In the conversation with the desk, it was clear they did not believe me and did not take the matter seriously. Instead, they started making excuses suggesting that I left the shirt on the bed when they removed the sheets. They did not believe me when I said that I never left anything on the bed, that I always left all my clothes in the closet. They said that they did not understand what happened, that their staff was very reliable and never accepted the fact that my shirt disappeared. The management was completely unresponsive. They really acted as if I was making it up or that it was unimportant. On top of it they did not give me any compensation as they had promised. The manager told me that she did not have any proof that the shirt existed. Of course, I don’t recommend this hotel to anyone. After that incident, I felt unsafe, violated and very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHRW7
Reviews.Content: Bit surprised about some of the reviews. We had a good time. Upon arrival the check in staff were very helpful, provided us with a map of the city and tips on where to go. The hotel is clean, well looked after and our room was sizeable and perfect for the trip. This is a hotel you want for when you spend a lot of time outdoors, and it is not right in the centre but an easy metro ride away to the centre. The area is very quiet, especially in weekends and in August when most business close. Breakfast was fine and we got a special deal on it (€10 instead of the normal price of €19). Really no complaints at all. If you want to go to Madrid and be more central though, this hotel does require 4 stops on the metro which is close by (a 5 min walk tops). If you want a quiet area, friendly staff and a clean place to stay then go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: elydia
Reviews.Content: Despite some minor concerns on my first visit, I chose Galgos for a second time for its convenient location. First time I had a standard room, which was extremely small. This time I chose the "superior" room and it was ok. Everything impecably clean, but wall to wall carpets and bathroom should be renewed soon, it is not up to 4 star anymore. Towels, cushions and bed linnen were excellent. Air-conditioning silent and easy to manage. Breakfast (untill 11.a.m.) is high quality, the area is at street level with a lot of windows. Personal is very kind. The so-called business center is not really efficient (opening time, no scanning, etc), but there is a cheap 24h business center 3 minutes walk away in Maria Molina street. For people who like to shop expensive, eat well or have some business nearby, Galgos is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonFroggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for its location. Indeed we walked nearly everywhere and hardly needed to take the metro. I think that this hotel caters mainly for business people as there is something quite cold and unfriendly about this hotel. I don't think that this hotel deserves its 4 stars: the bedroom walls would need to be redone, and we could hear the noises from the bathroom from the floor above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for us”
Reviews.Author: Martaribeiro
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel for me it's the location, it is close to the Salamanca neighbourhood that is the most hip and trendy one, close to good restaurants and Calles Goyas and Serrano known for their great shops. We stayed in a superior suite on the top floor (we went for a friends wedding and his father booked the room for us with special discount but they charged us regular fee to compensate us they gave us the sup. suite). The room was of course big but for a superior suite I tought it was quite low standards. the best thing about our top floor is that it was close to the spa area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel Near the American Embassy”
Reviews.Author: redeco
Reviews.Content: The Melia Galgos is a bit of a distance from the old city. It lies in the north part of the Salamanca district close to the American Embassy. However, taxi cabs are not very expensive in Madrid and a trip to Plaza Major is only about 8 Euros or so. Remember that cab drivers here take only three passengers, but if you smile and make an attempt at speaking the language, some drivers will take a fourth passenger up front. The Paseo de la Catellana is nearby and provides a scenic walk if you feel strong enough to walk down to the Prado, about a twenty minutes to half hour walk. The lobby is quite comfortable and is always full of people lounging in the intimate furniture groupings, or sitting in the bar area that is adjacent. The staff is friendly and bilingual and will change dollars into Euros. There are three elevators that are quick and efficient and halls are clean and beautifully carpeted. My room was small, but comfortable. One wall was completely draped floor to ceiling and the windows could be opened for fresh air (which is good because Spanish hotels seem to be overheated in February). There were two English language television stations. Closets are large with plenty of space for hanging clothing, a safe, and some shelving for storage. The room was furnished comfortably with desk and chair, beds, built-in end tables, and well-framed baroque architectural prints and mirrors on the walls. The bath is all marble - floors/walls/vanity. Soaps and amenities above average; hot water and water pressure very good. Towels plentiful and quite fluffy...no face cloths or tissues provided which is usual for European hotels. Breakfast is sensational. The buffet is extraordinary and includes the famous Jamon, smoked salmon, a half dozen smoked meats, wonderful frittata with potatoes, good fruits, sweets, breads, cereals, cheeses, and more. For those who don't like the Spanish offerings, a proper English breakfast was set up to one side including eggs, bacon, sausage, and toast. Juices were fresh-squeezed. I would recommend this hotel to most anybody. It's a bit of challenge to get downtown on the first day, but you quickly adjust to it. The neighborhood has dozens of good restaurants including A Mamma Mia (Italian) and Le Ursula (Spanish) about two blocks away over by the Museum on Ursula Street. Both of these were extraordinarily friendly places.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property with a tour group. Average at best. Our room was very small for a two people. The bathroom was not up to standards. No room to put your toiletries; no exhaust fan. Our view from the window was to an area where there was an opening in the center of the hotel where we looked out at other hotel room windows. The staff was friendly and helpful. No complaints in this area. If your room is important to you, or if you are sharing your room with someone, this is the wrong hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Travelsinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on business for the week. Not much in the surrounding area in terms of restaurants or nightlife. I would not have chosen this hotel if I were a tourist. The neighborhood, the Salamanca district, is one of Madrid's most exclusive, as evidenced by the shopping in the area. The hotel provided the basics; however, a kettle and coffee/tea was not provided, though many other Madrid hotels have it. Overpriced bar and restaurant. I will be going to Madrid again in June for business, and will stay at the Hotel Senator Gran Via which had every convenience you could think of, and more! I absolutely loved staying at that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: IrishKaren
Reviews.Content: I hadn't booked to stay here, I was originally at the Villa Real but had to move due to all of the noise from original hotel!!! This wouldn't have been my choice but we were in Madrid on a busy weekend and it was all we could get on a Fri morning, I have to say I think it is a really good hotel, we had a junior suiite which had a seperate bedroom and living area and a massive bathroom!!!!! The rate was 250 euros a night which I thought very reasonable. The hotel is a little way out, we walked into the centre at night but caught a cab home. The staff were very friendly and helped us choose restaurants to eat in, the bar was open every night when we got back and its a nice area to wind down in. We had room service breakfast which was little disappointing as it wasn't warm enough and not a great choice. The hotel is a little dated decor wise but overall I think it represents good value for money if you don't mind the walk into the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: fortune
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a nice location - a short bus ride to the centre of Madrid. My room was a nice size + very very clean. The breakfast was nice - good choices! The staff were very friendly but it took ages to check in as they weren't very fast!!! The downside to the hotel is that the walls are like cardboard - EVERY noise from next door can be heard - I was woken up by people in the next room "having a nice time"!!! Quite disturbing!!! Apart from that, the hotel was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Value: maximum 3 Spanish stars !”
Reviews.Author: gw01
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller world-wide I can not recommend this hotel when comparing price with value. The rooms are much too small, the breakfast is nothing special and simply standard, the advertised roof terrace is windy because of the ventilation machines (by the way it has a plastic green floor), the costs for the use of the small exercise room is tremendous (Euro 35 for a few hours), the whirlpool was out of order, there was no smoking area (you have to go out of the hotel and stand on the street) and so on and so on. Most of these things are not necessary to have but you have to pay for it and for this price you can find much better possibilities in Madrid. Summary: The value is maximum 3 Spanish stars ! The whole atmosphere in the hotel is old-fashioned, completly overloaded at minimum space and slightly smelling of "past times". The recepetion is helpful but take care and ask for better prices and offers (Reward card helps for having a free of charge breakfast for the second person but nobody will tell itto you). A re-freshing would be quite necessary !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: helcia
Reviews.Content: The entrance of Melia Galgos promises something that the standart room doesn´t hold. It only got 15 squaremeters and it went to the grey and narrow patio. In the morning, kitchen smells would get into the room. Room and bathroom were clean, breakfast ok for what it costs. Situation for shopping and eating is very good. Service was correct, but a bit indifferent and unpersonal. I have been told that this is not unusual for Madrid. I did find it correct, that my car was parked into the close-by (public)parking by the clerk, who also helped to unload and load the luggadge. Inspite of that, I am still looking for my favourit e hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: The Melia group of hotels are generally very satisfactory. This is one of their duff ones. It is perfectly clean but it is a souless place. As ever with certain Spanish Hotels, getting service is difficult. Check in was unwelcoming. Noone was available to carry bags to the room. Breakfast in the room was ok, but it was 30 minutes late. The hotel will not provide an Iron. I shall never stay here again. I was on business at the Felix, which was a nicer building, but once again coaching the staff to get drinks was a nightmare. A simple drinks order taking almost 30 minutes. Stay at the Palace, not here

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: gsfromc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business as close to our office. Great location, walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, bars and transit options yet is in a very quiet location. My room on sixth floor , the "executive level", was quite large with king bed, large bathroom. If you pay for the "Royal Service" level you get at no cost breakfast buffet (so-so), bar service from 16-23h, minibar access (a beer, couple liquor bottles, water and soft drinks), business center use, etc. I found that any staff I needed to speak with could handle English. AC worked well in the room, quiet as well. A good solid 4 star hotel, easy to get a good nite's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect place for shoppers!”
Reviews.Author: peterpan236
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three days and actually came back yesterday.I was a bit dissappointed at the hotel at first because my room was really very small and not overlooking the street.I think all single rooms are that small in this particular hotel.But I've been to some of the double ones where my friends were staying and they were a lot more spacious.The room was very clean and the bathroom was very nice.The hotel came in a very good prize,so good value for money.I found the hotel lobby very nice too.My only problem was that most of the staff didn't speak English and I certainly don't speak Spanish ,so it was kind of hard sometimes,especially when trying to order dinner over the phone.But the reception stuff are very nice and willing to settle all these things.The true advantage of this hotel is that it is so close to the Serrano Boulevard,a must place for shoppers like myself.I just loved the shops there.There were lots of beautiful clothes and in fairly low prizes.I didn't use the metro,so I don't know about that,but taxi fares are low in Madrid,it only costs about 5 euros to get from the hotel to Prado or Puerta del Sol and there's also a bus(number 51 I think) that stops very close to the hotel and goes to the so called historic centre of the city.I would definitely go back to this hotel,in fact I'm already planning on an extended holiday in Madrid in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the weekend (two nights, friday to sunday) and really liked it, great staff, very helpfull, nice big rooms (do not understand the previous review...) and filled up minibar (refilled every day) everything clean and neat, no complaints there. The restaurant's food was quite alright, absolutely nothing wrong with it, but there are a lot more cosier/more typical Spanish restaurants in the neighbourhood, so check'em out, you won't regret it!!! Breakfast was as it should be: a nice large buffet, hot and warm, great way to start your day! We'll especially remeber that - 'though we had already checked out by noon sunday - they let us have a room for an hour or two at five o'clock in the afternoon, so that we could refresh ourselves a little, before heading of to the airport - wich came in very handy after walking around in Madrid on a very hot day (!) That's what I call great service The hotel is situated practically across the American embassy in a classy area of Madrid (shoppers will love it as all the great and prestigious brands are on the great Serrano boulevard - one minute on foot from the hotel) You see, it's kinda hard to think of a flaw, we had a perfect minibreak in Madrid, and the hotel was definitely part of the succes!!

Reviews.Title: “not for demanding travellers”
Reviews.Author: demandingtraveller67
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, very helpfull, great location, but the rooms are not nice and dont even dare to take a single room because they are really for one person. Not recommended for demanding travellers, Gran Melia Fenix is a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RaginCajun1
Reviews.Content: Great facility. Rooms were very large and well decorated. Breakfast was great. Hotel staff were very helpfull to non spanish speaking individuals. Location was centrally located to transportation.

HotelInfo.Name: Melia Galgos
HotelInfo.Address: Claudio Coello 139, 28006 Madrid, Spain
